Quad-band XRS / YangWang Satellite Receiver

June, 2023

Focus: A high-dynamic, high-sensitivity satellite receiver designed for commercial aerospace onboard applications.

These studies were primarily applied to commercial spacecraft, requiring high-sensitivity signal reception at low cost and supporting the main frequency bands GPS L1/L2 and BeiDou B1/B3. I was fully responsible for the software development, which included designing protocols, an intermediate-frequency (IF) data-acquisition feature, and other client-driven functionalities; implementing the software; conducting system-reliability testing; and providing ongoing maintenance.

XRS, YangWang-2 & DFH Satellite Series — Multi-Constellation GNSS Receiver | Core Developer | IF Data Acquisition & Protocol/Feature Design | May 2023

Background / Goal: Build from scratch a highly compatible and reliable GNSS receiver that supports multi-band GPS / BeiDou / Galileo / GLONASS signals, with a focus on loss-free collection of 31 MB continuous IF data.

Key technical designs:

  • Autonomous communication protocol stack: Independently authored navigation-link specifications for the B045, YangWang-2 and DFH platforms.
  • Interface-driver development: Implemented and tuned embedded drivers for CAN or RS-422 interfaces and designed the accompanying protocol frames.
  • IF data-acquisition thread: Used a DMA + dedicated time-slice parallel architecture to read 31 MB of continuous data at high speed with zero-bit loss and no impact on other tasks.
  • Data-integrity verification algorithm: Created bespoke checking protocols and parsing scripts to detect bit errors or losses in IF data and pinpoint their locations.
  • Navigation-algorithm co-debugging: Performed closed-loop tuning of acquisition, tracking and synchronisation parameters to meet satellite-count and sensitivity targets.
  • GNSS-simulator testing: Ran independent functional/performance tests with a GNSS signal simulator and cooperated with the test team for system-reliability validation.
  • Technical documentation: Compiled operating protocols and principle manuals to support delivery and long-term maintenance.

Key achievements:

  • All tasks delivered on schedule; receiver sensitivity exceeded system targets by 2 dBm.
  • IF data-acquisition system ran stably with zero bit errors during testing.
  • Automated test cases achieved 100 % coverage and enabled loss-free high-speed transfer.

Tech stack: C • GNSS-protocol design • DMA • ZYNQ • DSP • Navigation algorithms • GNSS-simulator scripting
